lead_paragraph: At the height of the protests early Sunday evening, about 200 demonstrators marched in the heart of downtown, stopping traffic and shouting, “No justice, no peace, no racist police!”

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Nick Corasaniti and Colin Moynihan in Cleveland.
byline.original: By YAMICHE ALCINDOR and ALAN RAPPEPORT

headline.print_headline: Civil so Far, Cleveland Is Bracing for Worse
headline.main: A Civil Start to Protests, but Cleveland Is Bracing for Worse

snippet: At the height of the protests early Sunday evening, about 200 demonstrators marched in the heart of downtown, stopping traffic and shouting, “No justice, no peace, no racist police!”...
abstract: Cleveland police expect protests to escalate during Republican National Convention; 2,500 law enforcement officers from across nation are assisting in policing event.
